InspectionModelCategory.Description: Protection from Contamination by Food Handlers
Refrigerated and Frozen Storage of Hazardous Food

InspectionModelQuestion.Text: Thermometers are used to verify food prep and storage temperatures
Do food handlers ensure that food is protected from contamination?
Access to kitchen is limited to food handlers during public food preparation.
Exclusion of live animals on the premises
Cold holding is 4°C or less
Food protected from potential contamination (sneeze guard etc.)
Cooling, 60°C to 20°C within 2 hours
Washing hands thoroughly before and after handling food
Property installed fire suppression system
Separate raw foods from ready-to-eat foods during storage and handling
Freezers are -18°C or less
Thorough cooking to minimum internal temperature for at least 15 seconds
Cooling 20°C to 4°C within 4 hours
Food handlers user proper utensils to minimize direct hand contact with food
Hair is suitably confined
Chemicals/pesticides to be stored separately from food
High acid food stored/prepared in corrosion resistant containers or equipment
Kitchen staff wear appropriate clothing
Mechanical dishwashing has proper timing of cycles
Constant supply of hot and cold potable running water
Maintain separation of ready-to-eat foods from raw food preparation surface or utensils
All direct food contact surfaces / equipment are food-grade, maintained in good condition to allow for easy cleaning and sanitation and utensils are not re-used if disposable
Adequate protection against the entrance of vermin, dust, and fumes
Number of certified food handlers on duty
Reheating: To at least minimum internal cooking temperature within 2 hours.
Hot holding: minimum of 60°C after cooking
Number of compartments in sinks
Are food temperatures during storage and processing being controlled to maximize food safety?
Food handlers do not engage in food handling while ill and have acceptable attire, food handling habits and hygiene.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: a6ffb35d-0c1f-42d5-9519-0568a3f6e49d
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Thermometers must be designated food-grade.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: a6ffb35d-0c1f-42d5-9519-0568a3f6e49d
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Thermometers must be cleaned between each use.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: PUBLIC HEALTH RATIONALE: Food can become contaminated if the food handler does not provide proper food protection. It is essential that food handlers are aware of contamination sources and take the necessary measures to break the cycle of transmission.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Food and/or food products were stored on the floor at the time of the inspection

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: The regulations require food handlers to use clean utensils for tasting foods; the utensils must be immediately cleaned and sanitized after tasting and prior to tasting another food or the same food

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: The regulations require all food to be protected while in storage. Food must have protective covers and stored off the floor at least 15 cm (6 inches).

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Lubricant is not food-grade. Operator must immediately switch to food-grade lubricant

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: The regulations require raw fruits and vegetables to be thoroughly washed in potable water to remove soil and other contaminants before being cut, combined with other ingredients, cooked, served, or offered for human consumption in ready-to-eat form. This does not apply to whole raw fruits and vegetables that are intended for washing by the consumer following point of sale

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: BULK FOODS - CONTAINERS - Bulk food containers are not constructed properly, are not provided with a lid and/or are not in proper working order. All food used or to be used in a commercial food establishment must be protected from contamination and handled in a sanitary manner. AR 31/2006 s 23(1)

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: The regulations require that access to food preparation areas be restricted, as much as practically possible, to designated food handlers

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: FOOD CONTACT SURFACES - Cooked or prepared foods are subject to cross contamination from raw foods, unsanitary food contact surfaces or equipment. A commercial food establishment, all equipment and utensils in it and all surfaces in it with which food comes into contact must be maintained in a sanitary condition and, with out limiting the foregoing, must be washed and sanitized in a manner that removes contamination. AR 31/2006 s 28(2)

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: The regulations require food handlers to change plastic gloves after each use and discard the gloves after use to prevent cross-contamination issues

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: The regulations require all foods, that have been previously purchased and returned to the retailer or food service operation, must not be re-offered for sale to another consumer, unless those foods are low-risk, free from contamination and in their unopened and untampered original container.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: B PROTECT FROM CONTAMINATION - Food in this food establishment is not being protected from contamination during storage or handling. All food used or to be used in a bed and breakfastt must be protected from contamination and handled in a sanitary manner. AR 31/2006 s 52

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: SEPARATION OF UNINSPECTED - Proper measures are not being taken to ensure that uninspected meats are kept separate from inspected meats. Uninspected meat must be clearly labeled, adequately separated from other food and identified as not for public consumption to the satisfaction of the executive officer. AR 31/2006 s 22(2)

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Once food products are opened from their original containers, food products remaining must be transferred into properly covered food containers that can be easily cleaned

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: PACKAGING - Insanitary and/or inappropriate food packaging is in use. All food used or to be used in a commercial food establishment must be protected from contamination and handled in a sanitary manner. AR 31/2006 s 23(1)

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: B STORAGE IN WASHROOM - Food items or utensils were found in the washroom area. All food used or to be used in a bed and breakfastt must be protected from contamination and handled in a sanitary manner. AR 31/2006 s 52

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Condiments were not in a single service packages or dispenser with self-closing lids, which prevents the contamination of the food products

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: B FOOD CONTACT SURFACES - Cooked or prepared foods are subject to cross contamination from raw foods, unsanitary food contact surfaces or equipment. All food used or to be used in a bed and breakfast must be protected from contamination and handled in a sanitary manner. AR 31/2006 s 52

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: SEPARATE STORAGE - Articles not associated with food processing, preparation, handling, serving, or storage are stored with food. All articles and materials in a commercial food establishment that are not associated with or required for the operation or maintenance of the food areas must be stored separately from the food and the food areas and in a manner that contaminates neither. AR 31/2006 s 20(1)

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: CUSTOMER CONTAMINATION / SNEEZE GUARD - Publicly displayed food is not adequately protected from customer contamination. All food used or to be used in a commercial food establishment must be protected from contamination and handled in a sanitary manner. AR 31/2006 s 23(1)

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: The regulations require raw meats to be handled in a manner that prevents cross contamination

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: The regulations require raw meats, while in cold storage, to be separated or stored below ready to eat food products to prevent cross contamination issues

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: The regulations require all equipment lubricant to be food grade and measures taken to prevent the lubricant from getting into the food product.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Food used or to be used in the facility was not protected from contamination and/or handled in a sanitary condition. All food must be covered with approved covers while in storage

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: The regulations require all facilities where the public has access to food other than raw, unprocessed fruit and vegetables, or food specifically served to a customer by a worker of the food premises, the food shall be protected from public handling.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: F PACKAGING - Food is packaged in unacceptable containers. Food shall be packaged in food grade material. Disposable packages shall be clean and not previously used. AR 31/2006 2(3) & 23(1)

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: B PACKAGING - Insanitary and/or inappropriate food packaging is in use. All food used or to be used in a commercial food establishment must be protected from contamination and handled in a sanitary manner. AR 31/2006 s 52

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: B CONTAINERS - Unacceptable food storage containers or covers are in use. All food used or to be used in a bed and breakfast must be protected from contamination and handled in a sanitary manner. AR 31/2006 s 52

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: The regulations require food handlers to use clean and sanitary utensils such as tongs, spatulas, disposable gloves or other food dispensing apparatus for ready to eat foods and avoid handling foods with their bare hands, as much as practically possible

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Evidence that the facility operator is re-serving food was noted at the time of the inspection

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Food handlers did not wash their hands before handling food products. This is a cross-contamination issue that needs to be corrected immediately

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: B CUSTOMER CONTAMINATION / SNEEZE GUARDS - Publicly displayed food is not adequately protected from customer contamination. All food used or to be used in a bed and breakfast must be protected from contamination and handled in a sanitary manner. AR 31/2006 s 52

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: STORAGE IN WASHROOM - Food items or utensils were found in the washroom area. All food used or to be used in a commercial food establishment must be protected from contamination and handled in a sanitary manner. AR 31/2006 s 23(1)

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: F PROTECT FROM CONTAMINATION - Food is not being protected from contamination during storage, display, or handling. All food except whole fruits and vegetables must be protected from contamination and customer handling. AR 31/2006 s 36

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: BULK FOODS - UTENSILS PROVIDED - Adequate utensils or hand protection have not been provided for self serve of bulk foods. All food used or to be used in a commercial food establishment must be protected from contamination and handled in a sanitary manner. AR 31/2006 s 23(1)

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Ice must be protected from contamination. Ice machines must be maintained in a clean and sanitary condition

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: BULK FOODS - MAINTENANCE - The bulk food area is not being maintained or serviced. All food used or to be used in a commercial food establishment must be protected from contamination and handled in a sanitary manner. AR 31/2006 s 23(1)

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: CONTAINERS - Unacceptable food storage containers or covers are in use. All food used or to be used in a commercial food establishment must be protected from contamination and handled in a sanitary manner. AR 31/2006 s 24(1)

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: PROTECT FROM CONTAMINATION - Food in this food establishment is not being protected from contamination during storage or handling. All food used or to be used in a commercial food establishment must be protected from contamination and handled in a sanitary manner. AR 31/2006 s 23(1)

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: All food and food-related items must be stored in the mobile concession.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: BULK FOODS - PERISHABLE - Perishable food in bulk form is being offered on a self serve basis. All food used to be used in a commercial food establishment must be protected from contamination and handled in a sanitary manner. AR 31/2006 s 23(1)

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: The regulations require all incompatible areas or processes, particularly clean-up and chemical storage areas, be separated from food storage, handling and processing areas to prevent food and food area contamination.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9578a2b1-a711-4cfb-b1a9-0630cf5104d4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: INCOMPATIBLE ACTIVITY / LIVING QUARTERS - An incompatible activity (living/sleeping quarters, laundry, etc.) is occurring in a food handling or storage area. An operator shall ensure that, before the operation of a commercial food establishment, the food establishment has all it's food areas separated from living quarters and from other areas where activities are carried out that are incompatible with the safe and sanitary handling of food. AR 31/2006 s 16(1)(d)

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: dfdbf210-f1b2-4bd8-acf3-0a26f4d73f43
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Operator does not limit kitchen access to only food handlers during food preparation

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 5a925bb6-fddf-4841-b58d-0a42096832ca
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: The use of a service animal is exempt from this regulation.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 5a925bb6-fddf-4841-b58d-0a42096832ca
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: PUBLIC HEALTH RATIONALE: Animals in a food handling or preparation area are potential sources of contamination.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 5a925bb6-fddf-4841-b58d-0a42096832ca
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: This facility has an appropriate holding tank for live seafood.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 5a925bb6-fddf-4841-b58d-0a42096832ca
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: No animals, other than a service animal or an animal approved by a public health inspector is permitted in food establishment

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 4abe829d-c6b2-47e2-84a8-15a1c929f95c
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: All refrigerators should have thermometers in conspicuous locations.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 4abe829d-c6b2-47e2-84a8-15a1c929f95c
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Refrigerators should be cleaned frequently.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 0713ab90-be14-41ce-8f75-2776e7ce4828
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Sneeze guards are required on all hot and cold bars.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 0713ab90-be14-41ce-8f75-2776e7ce4828
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Dry goods may only be stored is containers approved for that purpose.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 0713ab90-be14-41ce-8f75-2776e7ce4828
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Pre-packaged ready-to-eat meals must be hermetically sealed.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 40946823-6131-45ec-8143-4ecd297a53c7
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Cooling at room temperature is not permitted.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: d1faf77f-33dd-41c3-aef5-5fc55f7c79b6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Do not use artificial nails.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: d1faf77f-33dd-41c3-aef5-5fc55f7c79b6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Keep nails short.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: d1faf77f-33dd-41c3-aef5-5fc55f7c79b6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Rub in between and around fingers.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: d1faf77f-33dd-41c3-aef5-5fc55f7c79b6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Wash wrists and forearms if they are likely to have been contaminated.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: d1faf77f-33dd-41c3-aef5-5fc55f7c79b6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Remove watches, rings and bracelets.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: d1faf77f-33dd-41c3-aef5-5fc55f7c79b6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Make sure that sleeves are rolled up and do not get wet during washing.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: d1faf77f-33dd-41c3-aef5-5fc55f7c79b6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Avoid chipped nail varnish.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: ae669ef2-9c3d-41ea-a7db-6069920434ea
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Fire suppression pull stations must be accessible at all times.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: ae669ef2-9c3d-41ea-a7db-6069920434ea
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Fire suppression system must be inspected annually.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: afd319a1-4a95-4e35-961b-7785964a562e
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Freezers need to be defrosted regularly to function at maximum efficiency.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: afd319a1-4a95-4e35-961b-7785964a562e
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Freezer does not have a thermometer in a conspicuous location.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: afd319a1-4a95-4e35-961b-7785964a562e
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Freezer drain pan is leaking.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 74480559-6a95-4771-9e02-7801aae6494e
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Minimum internal temperature for poultry is 85 °C (185 °F).

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 74480559-6a95-4771-9e02-7801aae6494e
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Minimum internal temperature for beef (non-ground) is 60 °C (140 °F).

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 0e93e283-daf6-4b31-b1f4-834ad66b64eb
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Chopsticks shorter than 15 cm (6") are not an acceptable utensil for food handling.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9c360ee3-74ec-4152-ba2e-8679dc8151f7
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: A Jewish Kippah is not considered sufficient for confining hair.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9c360ee3-74ec-4152-ba2e-8679dc8151f7
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Kitchen staff are all bald, no confining required.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: ed4f85b5-9fbe-4ca4-84f8-928713194ed5
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Chemical storage areas must be appropriately labeled and accessible independently from food preparation and storage areas.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 6c1de4e9-fab8-4a1f-8da0-980515a7958c
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: No high acid foods on site during inspection.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 6c1de4e9-fab8-4a1f-8da0-980515a7958c
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Cast iron containers are not corrosion resistant.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 469da5f0-5831-454b-8ffc-a387cca3389c
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: All staff are required to wear hair nets or hats while in the kitchen.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 469da5f0-5831-454b-8ffc-a387cca3389c
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: All staff are required to wear non-flammable clothing.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: ef8d7ee3-65e3-47d0-81c9-a413856a6727
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Mechanical dishwashing without detergent must have a disinfecting cycle with a minimum temperature of 90°C (195°F) for a minimum of 150 seconds.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: ef8d7ee3-65e3-47d0-81c9-a413856a6727
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Mechanical dishwashing must have a disinfecting cycle with a minimum temperature of 90°C (195°F) for a minimum of 45 seconds.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: ef8d7ee3-65e3-47d0-81c9-a413856a6727
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Mechanical dishwashing must have a pre-rinse cycle lasting at least 30 seconds.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 817d15a7-5dd7-4990-839e-aae30f831a33
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Hot water must be at least 60 °C but no more that 80 °C.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 817d15a7-5dd7-4990-839e-aae30f831a33
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Portable water supply in use.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 817d15a7-5dd7-4990-839e-aae30f831a33
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Private well on premises.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 6e22d920-b5e4-4904-91e7-b1ceb927c2c4
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Surfaces and utensils must be disinfected with detergent between each use.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9cda62cc-bf69-4392-b8ae-b8f67622f331
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Equipment must be maintained so that it can be cleaned and sanitized. Equipment must be inspected, properly vented when required and function in accordance with its intended use

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9cda62cc-bf69-4392-b8ae-b8f67622f331
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Single service utensils must not be used more than once

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9cda62cc-bf69-4392-b8ae-b8f67622f331
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Equipment, utensils and/or food contact surfaces are not food-grade and/or in a condition that allows for proper sanitation

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9cda62cc-bf69-4392-b8ae-b8f67622f331
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Food packaging is not maintained in good condition and/or is not suitable for food

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9cda62cc-bf69-4392-b8ae-b8f67622f331
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: The regulations require that packaging materials or atmospheric packaging gases, where used shall not cause harm to people exposed to them and shall not pose a threat to the safety and suitability of food under the specified conditions of storage and use

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9cda62cc-bf69-4392-b8ae-b8f67622f331
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Food packages shall be in good condition and protect the integrity of the contents so that the food within is not exposed to adulteration, damage or potentially harmful contaminants

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9cda62cc-bf69-4392-b8ae-b8f67622f331
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: The regulations require that equipment must be located so that it is not exposed to any sources of contamination unrelated to the normal operations of the food premises

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9cda62cc-bf69-4392-b8ae-b8f67622f331
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: The regulations require that all containers used for bottling and packaging and all equipment be designed and constructed so that they are cleanable, located in a clean and dry location

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9cda62cc-bf69-4392-b8ae-b8f67622f331
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: The regulations require that all food products received at a food premise be properly packaged and labelled, according to requirements outlined in the Food and Drugs Act and Regulation and the Consumer Packaging and Labelling Act and Regulations

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9cda62cc-bf69-4392-b8ae-b8f67622f331
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: The regulations require that all containers used for the storage of food, food ingredients, equipment and non-food materials such as utensils, linens, single-service and single-use utensils, and packaging be designed and constructed so that they are cleanable, located in a clean and dry location, restrict pest access and harbourage provide an environment which minimizes the deterioration of stored materials and protect food from contamination during storage

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9cda62cc-bf69-4392-b8ae-b8f67622f331
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: The regulations require that all equipment that is fixed or not easily moved must be either sealed to adjoining walls, floors and equipment or spaced in such a manner to allow for cleaning under and around equipment

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9cda62cc-bf69-4392-b8ae-b8f67622f331
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Equipment was found to be in a state of disrepair, which can hinder proper cleaning and sanitation and/or is a public or staff safety concern. Operator must take corrective action immediately

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9cda62cc-bf69-4392-b8ae-b8f67622f331
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Single use utensils must be used only once and discarded

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9cda62cc-bf69-4392-b8ae-b8f67622f331
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: The regulations require that all food contact surfaces of equipment must be made of materials that are corrosion resistant, made of materials that do not pass on colours, odours or tastes to food and do not allow migration of unsafe substances into food. Food contact surfaces of equipment must be smooth and non-absorbent, free from breaks, cracks, open seams, chips, pits and similar imperfections. Equipment must be free from sharp internal angles, corners and crevices, finished to have smooth welds and joints, and accessible for cleaning and inspection

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9cda62cc-bf69-4392-b8ae-b8f67622f331
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: PUBLIC HEALTH RATIONALE: Food contact surfaces and equipment may be sources of contamination. Food contact surfaces that are made from food grade materials and maintained in a condition that allows for proper sanitation will help to break the cycle of transmission.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9cda62cc-bf69-4392-b8ae-b8f67622f331
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Water bottles or ice packaging is not maintained in good condition and/or is not suitable for water or ice

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9cda62cc-bf69-4392-b8ae-b8f67622f331
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Water to dipper well was turned off at the time of the inspection

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9cda62cc-bf69-4392-b8ae-b8f67622f331
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Single service utensils are being reused at the time of the inspection. Operator must take immediate action to stop reusing single use utensils

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 9cda62cc-bf69-4392-b8ae-b8f67622f331
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: The regulations require all water bottles and ice packages be in good condition and protect the integrity of the contents so that the food within is not exposed to adulteration, damage or potentially harmful contaminants.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: df6ecd47-9bc7-434c-9f99-c489a7819bc3
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Exterior doors may only be left open, if an appropriate screen is in place.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: df6ecd47-9bc7-434c-9f99-c489a7819bc3
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: All exterior doors must have weather-stripping to prevent vermin entry.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: b1033f27-6e6a-4d73-a9e1-c9bd5ecc888d
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: One certified food handler is required for every three kitchen staff members.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: b1033f27-6e6a-4d73-a9e1-c9bd5ecc888d
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: At least one food handlers certification has expired.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 7cc5a4aa-b076-4a5a-a5ca-cd7af21458fc
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Unused food products may only be reheated once, and only if refrigerated promptly.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 7cc5a4aa-b076-4a5a-a5ca-cd7af21458fc
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Food must be reheated in appropriate containers.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 7cc5a4aa-b076-4a5a-a5ca-cd7af21458fc
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Reheating by placing food on vehicle engine block is not permitted.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 2de4796d-3d85-4f62-9348-dd816810004c
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Hot holding must be done in containers specifically designed for that purpose.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: a4c28707-c5b9-47d3-a4a0-e1c48a840785
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: The use of sinks for thawing food is only permitted if sink has more than three compartments, or additional sinks are available.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: a4c28707-c5b9-47d3-a4a0-e1c48a840785
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Washing uniforms or aprons dish water is not permitted.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 2e52c2a0-0326-4979-9a09-f38da6358c28
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: REHEATING FOODS - Foods are not being sufficiently reheated to kill foodborne disease organisms. All food processing must be done in a manner that makes the food safe to eat. AR 31/2006 s 24

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 2e52c2a0-0326-4979-9a09-f38da6358c28
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: B COOKING OF FOODS - The indicated high risk foods are not being cooked to their minimum safe internal temperatures. All food processing must be done in a manner that makes the food safe to eat. AR 31/2006 s 2(3) & 24

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 2e52c2a0-0326-4979-9a09-f38da6358c28
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: B GENERAL TEMPERATURE CONTROL - Perishable foods are not being kept at proper temperatures. Perishable foods must be kept at a temperature of less than 4*C or greater than 60*C at all times. AR 31/2006 s 52(f)

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 2e52c2a0-0326-4979-9a09-f38da6358c28
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: B HOT HOLDING OF FOODS - Cooked high risk foods are being held below 60 C during hot holding. Perishable foods must be kept at a temperature of less than 4*C or greater than 60*C at all times. AR 31/2006 s 52(f)

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 2e52c2a0-0326-4979-9a09-f38da6358c28
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: B REHEATING FOODS - Foods are not being sufficiently reheated to kill foodborne disease organisms. All food processing must be done in a manner that makes the food safe to eat. AR 31/2006 s 2(3) & 24

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 2e52c2a0-0326-4979-9a09-f38da6358c28
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: EGG TEMPERATURE - Eggs are not being held at proper temperatures. Whole raw shell poultry eggs must be held at a temperature not exceeding 7 C. AR 31/2006 s 25(3)

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 2e52c2a0-0326-4979-9a09-f38da6358c28
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: GENERAL TEMPERATURE CONTROL - Perishable foods are not being kept at proper temperatures. Perishable foods must be kept at a temperature of less than 4*C or greater than 60*C at all times. AR 31/2006 s 2(6) & s.25(1)

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 2e52c2a0-0326-4979-9a09-f38da6358c28
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: COOKING OF FOODS - The indicated high risk foods are not being cooked to their minimum safe internal temperatures. All food processing must be done in a manner that makes the food safe to eat. AR 31/2006 s 24

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 2e52c2a0-0326-4979-9a09-f38da6358c28
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: B THERMOMETER AVAILABLE - Functional thermometers are not available for monitoring foods. A food grade thermometer must be kept in the refrigerator and monitored on a regular basis. AR 31/2006 s 52

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 2e52c2a0-0326-4979-9a09-f38da6358c28
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: B FREEZER TEMPERATURE - Freezer temperature is above 0 C. All food that needs to be kept frozen in order to maintain its fitness for human consumtion must be and remain frozen while being stored or displayed. AR 31/2006 s 52(f)

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 2e52c2a0-0326-4979-9a09-f38da6358c28
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: THAWING OF FOODS - Frozen foods are being improperly thawed. All food processing must be done in a manner that makes the food safe to eat. AR 31/2006 s 24

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 2e52c2a0-0326-4979-9a09-f38da6358c28
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: F THERMOMETER AVAILABLE - Functional thermometers are not available for monitoring foods during cooling, cooking, reheating and/or display. An operator shall ensure that all refrigeration and hot holding equipment used in the food establishment are capable of maintaining the respective temperatures required by section 26 and equipped with an accurate thermometer. AR 31/2006 s 2(3) & 18(b)(ii)(iii)

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 2e52c2a0-0326-4979-9a09-f38da6358c28
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: FREEZER TEMPERATURE - Freezer temperature is above 0 C. All food that needs to be kept frozen in order to maintain its fitness for human consumption must be and remain frozen while being stored or displayed. AR 31/2006 s 25(2)

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 2e52c2a0-0326-4979-9a09-f38da6358c28
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: HOT HOLDING OF FOODS - Cooked high risk foods are being held below 60 C during hot holding. Perishable foods must be kept at a temperature of less than 4*C or greater than 60*C at all times. AR 31/2006 s 2(6) & s.25(1)

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 2e52c2a0-0326-4979-9a09-f38da6358c28
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: B THAWING OF FOODS - Frozen foods are being improperly thawed. All food processing must be done in a manner that makes the food safe to eat. AR 31/2006 s 2(3) & 24

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 2e52c2a0-0326-4979-9a09-f38da6358c28
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: F EGG TEMPERATURE - Eggs are not being held at proper temperatures. Whole raw shell poultry eggs must be held at a temperature not exceeding 7 C. AR 31/2006 s 36 (2)

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 2e52c2a0-0326-4979-9a09-f38da6358c28
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: B REFRIGERATION OF FOODS - Foods under refrigeration are not being maintained at or below 4 C. Perishable foods must be kept at a temperature of less than 4*C or greater than 60*C at all times. AR 31/2006 s 52(f)

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 2e52c2a0-0326-4979-9a09-f38da6358c28
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: B COOLING OF FOODS - Cooked hot food is not being chilled rapidly. All food processing must be done in a manner that makes the food safe to eat. AR 31/2006 s 2(3) & 24

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 2e52c2a0-0326-4979-9a09-f38da6358c28
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: THERMOMETER AVAILABLE - Functional thermometers are not available for monitoring foods during cooling, cooking, reheating and/or display. An operator shall ensure that all refrigeration and hot holding equipment used in the food establishment are capable of maintaining the respective temperatures required by section 26 and equipped with an accurate thermometer. AR 31/2006 s 18(b)(ii)(iii)

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 2e52c2a0-0326-4979-9a09-f38da6358c28
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: REFRIGERATION OF FOODS - Foods under refrigeration are not being maintained at or below 4 C. Perishable foods must be kept at a temperature of less than 4*C or greater than 60*C at all times. AR 31/2006 s 2(6) & s.25(1)

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 2e52c2a0-0326-4979-9a09-f38da6358c28
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: F GENERAL TEMPERATURE CONTROL - Perishable foods are not being kept at proper temperatures. A stallholder must not offer for sale, distribute, provide, or otherwise make available to the public any perishable food unless it is kept at a temperature of less than 4*C or greater than 60*C at all times. AR 31/2006 s 36(1)(c)

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 2e52c2a0-0326-4979-9a09-f38da6358c28
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: B EGG TEMPERATURE - Eggs are not being held at proper temperatures. Whole raw shell poultry eggs must be held at a temperature not exceeding 7 C. AR 31/2006 s 52(f)

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: 2e52c2a0-0326-4979-9a09-f38da6358c28
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: COOLING OF FOODS - Cooked hot food is not being chilled rapidly. All food processing must be done in a manner that makes the food safe to eat. AR 31/2006 s 24

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Food handlers are not to engage in eating while in the process of food handling

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Food handler attire is not suitable for food handling and could be a source of cross-contamination

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: PUBLIC HEALTH RATIONALE: Living quarters are not generally built to meet commercial requirements for the preparation or for the protection of food.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Hand washing is of the utmost importance to prevent the spread of food borne illness. Operator must ensure food handlers wash hands as often as necessary to prevent the contamination of food and food products

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Food handler attire is not suitable for food handling and could be a source of cross-contamination

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Food was not protected from public or environmental contamination. Operator must take immediate action to ensure food protection

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Poor food handler habits noted at the time of the inspection. Operator must take corrective action immediately

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Operator did not have a handwash station readily accessible at the time of the inspection. Operator must cease all food service until a handwash station is available in the booth and approved by a public health inspector

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Evidence that food handling staff are smoking in the food preparation area. Operator must ensure smoking areas are completely separate from all food preparation and food storage areas

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Food handler hair is not controlled and could be a source of cross-contamination

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Observed food handlers handling food in a manner that can result in food borne illness. Operator must take corrective action immediately

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: The regulations require food handlers to change plastic gloves after each use and discard the gloves after use to prevent cross-contamination issues.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Food handlers are not to wear jewellery while engaging in food handling

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Individuals who suffer from illness are not to engage in food handling

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Food handler attire is not suitable for food handling and could be a source of cross-contamination

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Poor food handler habits noted at the time of the inspection. Operator must take corrective action immediately

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Foods must be covered or individually wrapped to prevent contamination

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Food handler hair is not controlled and could be a source of cross-contamination

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Hand washing is of the utmost importance to prevent the spread of food borne illness. Operator must ensure food handlers wash hands as often as necessary to prevent the contamination of food and food products

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Food was not protected from public or environmental contamination. Operator must take immediate action to ensure food protection

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: The regulations require all living or sleeping quarters located adjacent to a food premises must be separated from rooms and areas used for food preparation or storage by complete partitioning and solid self-closing doors.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Foods must be covered or individually wrapped with approved materials to prevent contamination

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Food handler hair is not controlled and could be a source of cross-contamination

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Hand washing is of the utmost importance to prevent the spread of food borne illness. Operator must ensure food handlers wash hands as often as necessary to prevent the contamination of food and food products

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Observed food handlers handling food in a manner that can result in food borne illness. Operator must take corrective action immediately

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: The regulations recommends all food handlers have approved food safety training. Please call Wendy Hartley at 403-388-6689 for more information on food safety training courses.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: The regulations require food handlers to wash their hands before handling food products to prevent the cross contamination of food products

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Observed food handlers handling food in a manner that can result in food borne illness. Operator must take corrective action immediately

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Hand washing is of the utmost importance to prevent the spread of food borne illness. Operator must ensure food handlers wash hands as often as necessary to prevent the contamination of food and food products

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Food handler attire is not suitable for food handling and could be a source of cross-contamination

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: A person must not work as a food handler if prohibited from working by or under the Communicable Diseases Regulation (AR 238/85) to prevent the cross- contamination of foods.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: PUBLIC HEALTH RATIONALE: Food handler health, attire and habits are important to prevent cross-contamination and break the cycle of transmission.

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Food handler hair is not controlled and could be a source of cross-contamination

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Poor food handler habits noted at the time of the inspection. Operator must take corrective action immediately

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Individuals who suffer from illness are not to engage in food handling

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Poor food handler habits noted at the time of the inspection, such as lack of hand washing. Operator must take corrective action immediately

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Operator living quarters are not separated from commercial food establishment

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Individuals who suffer from illness are not to engage in food handling

InspectionModelCannedComment.Question: abe8349b-9c1e-48e1-8d09-fbb4fa7874d6
InspectionModelCannedComment.Description: Observed food handlers handling food in a manner that can result in food borne illness. Operator must take corrective action immediately
